intro: Silene breviauriculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf campion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Silene breviauriculata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
